projectPurpose: To provide a simple, open-source, and scalable database specifically designed for storing and querying AI embeddings, facilitating the development of AI-native applications like those using Large Language Models (LLMs) for tasks such as semantic search and retrieval augmented generation (RAG).
mainFeatures: Simple, fully-typed API with integrations (LangChain, LlamaIndex)
Automatic tokenization, embedding, and indexing (with custom options)
Metadata filtering and advanced query capabilities

alternatives.name: Weaviate
alternatives.license: Open Source - BSD 3-Clause (and Proprietary Cloud Service)
mainFeatures: Supports vector, keyword, and hybrid search

alternatives.name: Vespa
mainFeatures: Fully featured search engine and vector database
Vector, lexical, and structured data search

alternatives.name: Vald
mainFeatures: Highly scalable distributed ANN search engine

alternatives.name: Pgvector
mainFeatures: Combines vector search with SQL queries
Integrates vector data into relational databases

marketPositioning: Chroma positions itself as the AI-native open-source embedding database with a strong emphasis on developer experience and ease of use. It targets developers building AI applications, particularly those leveraging LLMs, by simplifying the process of working with embeddings. Its open-source nature and embeddable capabilities offer flexibility compared to managed services. While competing with other open-source vector databases offering broad feature sets and scalability, Chroma carves out a niche by focusing specifically on the embedding workflow and seamless integration with popular AI frameworks.
